dDlm45GgYVMl_Jze1g2i9Q.text: I don't think this is terribly authentic the menu has been adapted for richer English palates. Let's face it its probably better for it or for us who expect more punch meals. This is its strength each dish is rich and deeper than an original the quality 90%of the time is great. I especially love the Penne Arrabiata simple yet packed with more garlic than is decent. Pizza fantastic but still pizza Euforia at Wimbledon Chase the best I had in London this a close 2nd. Service now far too loud on Saturday to be relaxed. Prefer it when the waiters just tried to Dance now loud music plays all night on sat I just go on the week or sin afternoon. Still really tasty food and good value. Also do take away.

qsxiEezRVcUvah1dZKIqVA.text: Food was excellent with jovial staff. Only visit if you have a hearty apetite, as all the portions were large and bursting with flavour. A must for real Italian lovers!

iK6YI_iKE3TpF5h1C4cqdw.text: This is one of the best places in London for a pizza. The pizzas are huge, the staff are friendly and the place has a lovely buzz. We went in a big group and were seated upstairs, we received excellent service. Management of the place is great and you can see that their personal touch makes all the difference in the running of this top notch restaurant. It is a nice family environment as well. Will definitely go back and recomment to all that I can. There is parking in the roads alongside the restaurant but cannot be accessed from main road as the restaurant is on a one way street.

L0di9dMKqp1gHBnCeQEPQg.text: This is a fun restaurant with excellent home cooked real italian food. Staff are lively and friendly. The Pizza is stone oven baked, highly recommend the Calzone. Prices very reasonable. You need to book as this place is often busy, even in the week. Enjoy

7Ef2iBm8xoGs1wVO4e8eKw.text: very nice italian food and pizza the vibe is really nice and buzzy, all of this at average prices.

MRkq-ukp28lqlqsfZr3sqA.text: I really enjoy this place. Huge portions for great price. Entree comes with garlic bread, salad, and soup included. The pasta is awesome. Being there makes me feel like I'm at some authentic east coast Italian place.

5LJuWkiBsrxctLLNOTzwog.text: Al Forno and the service are wonderful! Absolutely my favorite Italian restaurant anywhere!

gEAWgG67Hh5aM2D2qF9tUg.text: great taste and servingsyou need an empty tummy for this place.I would definetly recomend this place as its reasonable prices aswell as great tasting so a good combo. The lasagna is lovely but my favourite dish is hte seafood rissotto, full of prawns clams and mussels. They also have some very nice deepfried calamari

zvRBKBTYsuSkLK9SWM5DKA.text: The food is great and the atmosphere is brilliant.If you live in the area or intend to visit Wimbledon, you need to visit this place. Word of caution: If you simply want a very quiet night out this is really not the place for you as the waitresses and waiters can be loud at times and crack a few jokes however it is harmless fun that adds to the beauty of the evening,

6ULTaJE1wbmD80y0DrnBLw.text: I've been to hundreds of restaurants, but I loved this one. Really nice authentic restaurant with great service, welcoming atmosphere and delicious Italian food. I felt like I was back in Italy and will absolutely recommend it to all my friends.

qCHWGjB9i3cKdbXTLd-rww.text: Had a great night in here when I was catching up with the girls. Great food and will make a fuss out of you if it is your Birthday as we saw when dining in there!

r3TuYnaExyjgX4gkRGyX1Q.text: Great place. Portions could be bigger, and its quite expensive.

QguFNwnT0iDZJ7OerflBFw.text: Al forno is the best place to eat in Wimbledon. Simple as that. Located just off the middle of Wimbledon Broadway (near the theatre). This intimate restaurant simply buzzes with activity. The waitors are vibrant and friendly and will ensure whatever occasion you may be celebrating will be rewarded with good service (and often a shooter on the house if your in party mood!!).The steak here is brilliant, the pizza's are amazing (be warned - the medium size alone is enough to feed 2) and the food has been amazing every time I have eaten here.

e7I0bOAYdu6Rp_63rVtntA.text: Good Italian Food and fantastic warm welcome from these Portuguese restaurateurs. The food here is good and the wood fired oven does help pizza taste that little bit better here. A warm welcome is customary here as they put on the 'Italian' charm but that said it is a nice, fun place to visit from time to time. Besides in the chain shop hell that is Wimbledon, an independent like this have to be a bit special to survive. Prices are reasonable and if it is your birthday, shots always seem to turn up as these guys like to party.

Z58qPHocTWuCTWd5qpvpdg.text: Undoubtedly delicious. I experienced the Chef's special, followed the waiters advice , and wrapped up off with a fantastic ice cream dish .Classic cookery, served up in an unpretentious dining room without a great amount of fuss. The meat definitely speaks for itself, and though non-meat eaters may unearth their choice quite limited, it's a carnivore's bliss. A few of business-types here on a week day lunchtime, but the atmosphere was still fairly casual.Program was helpful, attentive and regarded as without having to be pushy or stuffy. Will undeniably go back to try a number of the a bit more audacious meals

kkw5Ur2rRU1OJIG-raAZLw.text: If your after a table in a quiet corner for a romantic meal then don't go here. But if your after great Italian food, great atmosphere and service with a smile this is the place. The Italians running this place and loud and have a great sense of humour. The food is excellent with all Italian fares catered for. One word of warning is the size of the pizza's, they are huge. The pizza's are very tasty and have a great selection of toppings. The drinks menu is extensive and some good tasting wine on there. I have been here with a big group for a birthday once and they really made the occasion special with waiters breaking into song. Its very reasonably priced as well.

lgFXb7x8Rb8SEl2UDNghbQ.text: fantastic value and huge portions. I definetly recommend this place.

Eo4yXdEr-1dzdcgK63bKfw.text: From exterior to interior, this restaurant is traditionally decorated. The staff is completely Italian and full of lively and engaging attitudes of a company that enjoy their job and do it with great aplomb. Despite being a large group, everything came out without a large wait for any, which many could be forgiven for expecting from such a large order in a busy establishment. Speaking of large orders, beware of food sizes. The large pizza option is for those who feel they can eat close to their own body weight. I just about did, but couldn't squeeze in one of the lovely looking desserts. If you fancy somewhere un-chain-restaurant-like, go here. Affordable, different, and good house wines for only a tenner.

iBFP9oeyHHyiNgeQ8F7CsA.text: If you go to Al Fornos you can expect very friendly service and very big pizzas. The staff can sometimes be friendlier than you might expect but that's just because they're Italian. The small pizza is enough for a hungry person. The medium is enough for 2 hungry people. Don't order the large if you're sitting at a small table because you will have to move. The pizzas are delicious and the banoffee dessert is fabulous.

78mdDVDR2NZtzJ2SXdfnQA.text: Love the smell of garlic as you enter and the decor takes me right back to the 70s, heyday of Italian restaurants and coffee shops. We went for lunch and the place was quite busy. The waiter was as italian as the chianti bottles decorating the ceiling, took our order fairly quickly. I asked for a small pizza and thought he had not heard because I got one the size of a large dinner plate but then I saw a large pizza arriving at a nearby table on a wooden board the size of my coffee table! I had the 'pescatori', decorated with prawns, mussels and baby squid. A perfect thin and light crispy base (very authentic) and it was very tasty, though I struggled to finish it. I chose a rocket salad to accompany it, which was nice and fresh, with a tangy dressing and parmesan shavings. My companions had a generous tuna steak and a large plate of calamari, which they said were very good. A good coffee to finish was all we could manage, so I can't comment on the deserts. Recommended!

pNrfani37BBLDeD17fNnag.text: For authentic Italian food at reasonable prices, Al Forno's is a solid bet. The pizzas are very generous and the rest of the menu mouth-watering. The service is fast and friendly and if you stay late enough may include some impromptu opera and dancing! One of the most consistently good Italian restaurants I have found in London  give it a try!

P5CYyaublJFfaeRkX5lJbA.text: This is the friendlest restaurant in Wimbledon, the atmosphere is really warm, the staff seem to enjoy their job, the food is pretty good and not too dear. you can feel relaxed here but at the same time still feel that you are having a nice romantic dinner; what I mean by this is: I think you can make it what you want, posh or casual, there is no set rules, which is nice.

DGRy7p-Cv5G3bBMaYLXEVw.text: I love this place. For anyone who wants amazing, authentic Italian without being in a white tablecloth fancy establishment.

Tfv8s2Lkn2g7nbkduqnrhQ.text: A very nice place if you want to share a pizza with your friends or relatives. We celebrated two birthdays over there. The staff is friendly and bring their personal touch.

KkTjxcKjFORbf-pq06BNjA.text: We started going here years ago when we were young and carefree for romantic dinners and parties with friends and now we love going with our two year old. Thanks to the authentic wood-fired oven it's the best pizza we've ever had outside Italy but everything we've ever tried from scampi and tomato sauce, to seabass or steak has been oustanding. The staff are friendly, fun and professional. Love it!

XpRiqOlEq3dAnqDDprIPWw.text: Great food.Warm in the outside seating area.I had the seafood pasta.Close to Wimbledon station!Would visit again!

photos.caption: Photo of Alforno Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

fnlNswy0I82GuenBFWPfBA.text: Super friendly, cosy fun family vibe (and by family I mean loving, not full of kids). Great food, good service, lovely atmosphere. If anything though, a little bit loud?

3wT4bi-1_o0i70qeahGPrw.text: A bit slow on service for a regular lunch time place to eat but food was amazing & they do gluten free pasta

nUMH9vhxLp8lYIpSnd3p_A.text: Very delicious and reasonable priced. It is recommended to make a reservation if going on the weekends, since it can get quite busy.

eO1I-buKOHQNqtBxrcNWSw.text: Food wasn't as good as its use to be, service seems to be lacking as well. Which is a shame as the restaurant use to be one of our favourites. As you walk into the restaurant it gives you the feel of being back in Italy, they also have a a new large menu. Normally I find the food to be very delicious here however last time I was there the waiter was very rude. We ordered a mix plate of bruschetta (doesn't say what kind), it turned up with 5 different topping (additionally these tasted bland), and when we asked the waiter to explain what they were he looked at us like we had 3 heads!It also took an hour for them to prepare our mains, others had theirs served before us (we hadn't ordered anything fancy, just a pasta dish and a lasagna). We had to ask how long our food was going to take as they kept saying "coming shortly". After this again no apology. Food tasted okay.

photos.caption: Photo of Alforno Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

Czsy4szlWccvADGjbMCMpw.text: I love Alforno! And last night was the perfect night for it - 26º and the sun's still out at 8pm - come on London summer. We got a table outside, right by the window to the pizza ovens, which meant we were practically drooling while we waited for our meals to arrive. It was busy and noisy and every bit as atmospheric as an Italian restaurant should be, but in that way that makes you feel like you are still enjoying an intimate dinner with the other people at your table. It's like the babble creates a bubble.The food was delicious, I ordered a tagliatelle with prawns and avocado, covered in a creamy tomato sauce and it was excellent. I've had the penne arrabiata on another visit, so simple and so perfect.They also do their pizzas by the metre, which is my plan for next time - can I eat a metre of pizza? Well we'll soon see.

VTSsxpskkMEq9IXvHFjxUA.text: We've been going here for years. Cheap and good food with friendly service. The pizzas are especially shockingly huge and tasty!

AartJuip5rwLB-TEDEbpjw.text: I have been to Al forno several times and it never disappoints! Great selection of Italian pizza and pastas and a great dessert menu! They're wonderful for birthdays as the friendly staff brig out a desert and candle and sing happy birthday to you! Very friendly atmosphere so perfect for families with small children. Hardly 2 minutes from New Wimbledon Theatre and close to buses, trams and trains!

vREQlrJFFRAl4JWYRkzQRw.text: I think people come here for the large fresh pizzas. I don't mind a relaxed service but this was super slow with plenty staff and they were not especially busy.Wouldn't  return.

oQRSk3unHnUnD-07PhICBg.text: Lovely family restaurant, the service is great, the food is fresh and I would recommend to book in advance! This place is always busy and there are normally queues outside in the evening! Two things I would recommend here would be the pizza ( the biggest pizza I've seen that can be shared with many people unless if can try eat a whole one), and the pasta dishes are so fresh and cooked perfectly!

cxZw0FSHy-BTCd_UVl5RSA.text: I love this place.When I lived in Wimbledon that was my once per week treat dinner. I even had my couple birthdays dinners too.The staff is very friendly and soooo much fun. They will do anything to make your experience there as fun as possible. I came back after 2 years and even the waitresses were the same. Such a great place.The food is amazing! The large pizza is Really large so you might need help if its only two of you.All pastas are delicious and very authentic. I do recommend this place for dinner or function.I wish I still live in London....

dVAQlX4XE8oqIf8kf4cAoA.text: Rocket and Parma Ham are my two favourite things. Now slap them on a pizza? There's only one other Italian place that did that, and they were located in Napa, California. Now I can get a fantastic one to myself and it's a short walk from my flat? FANTASTIC!Just a lovely restaurant. Two levels, indoor and outdoor seating, and two bars. Just a lovely place with great service and friendly staff. Can't wait to bring my family here! :)

PDoBRFAKcDZzP7gyDD0uQg.text: A restaurant run by true Italians with an authentic Italian spirit and atmosphere. The staff is quite attentive and enthusiastic and more importantly they have a skilled chef in the kitchen. If you appreciate original Italian food and not some adapted versions of it this is a must visit place. I would recommend trying the steak with porcini mushrooms and parmesan served on a bed of rocket alonside a glass of red to compliment its taste.

6vniQQ_mUuZdMNSYWGzi7A.text: Very good, traditional Italian pizza. Pasta menu somewhat lacking. Very large portions! Great food!

UpkO9SMASXU2fb0fsXttHQ.text: Soooo good!! Food always large dishes and staff always helpful and hilarious. Great place for a birthday.

TgLNhGGKehgADPyLSwTN_g.text: I lived in Wimbledon for almost three years and it took me at least 18 months before i even realised this lovely Italian side street restaurant existed, but i'm so glad i discovered it eventually!It's a rustic style Italian with the essential brick pizza oven. The menu is very affordable and the food is great. They have a fantastic range of pizzas, pastas, fish dishes , grills and veggie options.Being a bit of a cheese freak the Quattro Fromagi was delicious for me and for 14 pounds i got a 'medium' pizza but for me this was more like a large. The large pizzas are massive!The staff are great, really friendly and easy to have a laugh with, the atmosphere on a busy evening is great and for all of these reasons i highly recommend a visit to Al Fornos.

photos.caption: Photo of Alforno Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

vlz4bi3oHyquNqFuMVinTQ.text: Al Forno's is Wimbledon's bonafide Italian restaurant. Set over a two level shop front just left of Wimbledon Broadway, Al Forno's offers the discerning eater a range of pizzas, pastas, seafood and grill options all cooked in authentic Italian style. My favourite part is ordering from a real Italian waiter, all of who know Italian food very well, and have probably spent many a day fending off their grandmother's requests to feed them.You must request the four in one option of Al Forno's pizza range: this pizza is absolutely huge and cooked to perfection. I would go as far as to say that their four-in-one pizza is one of the best I've tasted. Margarita and pepperoni, meat, chicken and Italian sausage were our choices, and for £15, the effects of four full satisfied stomachs were quite apparent thereafter. Our waiter even got a complimentary shooter as thanks for his tip.

photos.caption: Photo of Alforno Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Al Forno's
Photo of Alforno Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Al Forno's

hDS-kl1vXQk3fQEaVpFUBA.text: Home to possibly the biggest pizza I've ever eaten.  Great buzz in this Wimbledon local.Did I mention the gigantic pizza, I blame my friends, peer pressure has never tasted so good though! Except for the extra spicy chilli's billed as peppers. Couldn't tell you what else was on the menu but judging by the busy crowd in here I'm sure it's more then super-sized pizzas getting the punters in.Apparently the red wine was foul, according to Dave the wine critic, all in all a great night. Roll on Mojitos and jumping up and down, which we'll call dancing.

F9bAC9u-BOmTUoDl6EgOOw.text: I have moved in the area a few month ago and had yet to find a place I would really enjoy going for dinner to with a few friends....well I think I have found it!This cute Italian resaturant offers one of the best service I have had in a We went there on a very busy Friday night and yet the staff (from the waiters to the chefs that we could see cooking from where we were) looked really relax, friendly and professional.I would recommend the filet steak (with pepercorn or gorgonzola sauce) as it is really tender and delicious....that with a nice bottle of Italian red, amazing!

OxBtQjrwenhguGjfBRsDHA.text: The service is great, almost too friendly and attentive at times. So much food. We always leave with leftovers. Each entree comes with a soup, salad, and garlic bread. I really love their Italian dressing and garlic bread.I have a feeling I'll be coming here a lot since a friend just moved basically right next door to the restaurant.
